channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Road repair of a poor quality, 24th June
item.description:
You assured the local people that the road here would be properly repaired after numerous potholes formed over the winter. Instead a thin layer of tarmac has simply been laid over the uneven surface, effectively masking the potholes. The road is still as rough as ever, and now more dangerous as it's harder to see the potholes. This was evident this morning after heavy rain left many puddles in the divots on the road. Please can the road be fixed properly.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Churchdown Lane, Hucclecote, Gloucester
Report on FixMyStreet

item.description:

item.title: Gravel in layby, 23rd June
item.description:
Our shared driveway between houses Pasaderas & Whitewalk have continuous problems when it floods. The hardcore/gravel is washed away and leads to an unsafe surface when exiting and arriving at our houses. We have paid many times for hardcore to be delivered and we put it down ourselves. At the moment we are having a dry spell and ideal time for the surface to be levelled out. Hope you can assist.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Ermin Way, Badgeworth, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet
item.category: Other damage to pavement i.e. cobbles, raised mound/surface

item.title: Road markings too faint, 23rd June
item.description:
As live at Pasaderas notice daily cars driving too fast round the corner by the Twelve Bells pub in direction up to Birdlip. They don't stick to their side of the road and encroach into the other lane. Today I had to swerve to avoid a car. The road markings are now non-existent and the SLOW down marking is no longer visable. It would also help to have a slow sign before approaching that corner maybe on the grass verge by Twelve Bells. Anything you can do to avoid car accidents. When the A417 road is closed overweeks it is even worse. The traffic is so busy all day and all night.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Ermin Way, Badgeworth, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet
item.category: General road markings, lines and stud issues

item.description:

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 194, Leckhampton Road, Leckhampton, Cheltenham

item.title: Trees require maintenance, 23rd June
item.description:
Right hand side of Laxton road trees and foliage have not been maintained for many years.These branches are in need of cutting back at a high level due to trees being severely overgrown and encroaching into the parking area. Trees have grown extremely tall and branches are now also touching end property (number 28) causing damage to guttering. Falling branches along tree line also pose risk to parked cars. These trees are located on the border between the Green lane footpath and Laxton road residential parking, and require maintenance all the way around from the beginning of parking area to the surrounding footpath to Green lane.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Laxton Road, Gloucester
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Weak Bridge, 23rd June
item.description:
The bridge is located on Brockhampton Lane, Cheltenham, GL51 9RS. I have large concerns over a small bridge that goes over the stream. There have been large lorries going over the bridge. I believe there should be a weight restriction in place and signage around.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Brockhampton Lane, Kingsditch, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.category: General road markings, lines and stud issues

item.title: General road markings, lines and stud issues problem, 23rd June
item.description:
Please see attached e-mail from a resident living in Oakdene, which is in the corner of Hatherley and Lansdown Road in Cheltenham. They are complaining about the "KEEP CLEAR " road markings at the entrance to Block of flats @ Hatherley Court & Oakdene which need repainting, as they are nearly obliterated. I can testify to this being dangerous myself, as I had to exit from their carpark onto Hatherley Road myself, this morning. The "KEEP CLEAR " road markings at the entrance to Block of flats @ Hatherley Court & Oakdene need repainting, as they are nearly obliterated. We have already had one accident as a result of one of the drivers not seeing the markings.
Report on FixMyStreet
item.category: General road markings, lines and stud issues
